intro: Haplopappus fremontii, commonly known as the Fremont's pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive bracts. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers are followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Haplopappus fremontii plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for small insects and animals.
